page.title: 09Schools: w.Strood/Cobham
page.content: The Bligh Infant and Junior Schools cater for children up to the age of 11, and the pupils all live comparatively close to the schools. The Junior School has over 250 pupils. Rede Secondary School provides a broad secondary education for over 800 boys and girls from 11 to 16 years who have not been selected to attend local grammar schools. Cobham Hall is an independent school with 300 girls, mostly boarders, aged 11 _ 18 and Gads Hill Place School is a private school with over 200 girls aged 4 _ 16, set in Dickens' old house. All these schools take an interest in local concerns and participate in various community activities.
